content.description: Start matched on the same jug as the direct problem, but keep right after the first large flake through thinning cracks to the right lip of the boulder. Staying further right ups the difficulty as the holds get smaller, so choose the route that suits you.
content.protection: Pads and spotter. Potentially uneven landing.
content.location: North east side of the boulder, and should get good shade for most of the day. Obvious face with diagonal cracks visible while walking up hill. Shares same start as direct.

content.description: Start at the obvious jug to the lower left of the face, follow the diagonal cracks right and up, topping out right of the tree branches
content.protection: pads and spotter. the landing is a little suspect

content.description: Sit start compressed on the arete and make moves on dishes and edges upward towards slopers and incuts at the top. Beware the sap and tree branches on your way out.
content.location: South corner of the boulder overlooking the valley. Situated next to a pine tree that drops sap everywhere. Nearby tree should provide shade through the day, but otherwise evenings will give you coverage.
